The Maiden's entourage sang the following song while advancing through the forest:

_‘The Happy Trinity is her home: nothing can trouble her joy._

_Bogies will not scare her in the dark: bullets will not frighten her in the day._

_Falsehoods tricked out as truths assail her in vain: she sees through the lie as if it were glass._

_The invisible germ will not harm her: nor yet the glittering sun-stroke._

_A thousand fail to solve the problem, ten thousand choose the wrong turning: but she passes safely through._

_He details immortal gods to attend her: upon every road where she must travel._

_They take her hand at hard places: she will not stub her toes in the dark._

_She may walk among Lions and rattlesnakes: among dinosaurs and nurseries of lionets._

_He fills her brim full with immensity of life: he leads her to see the world’s desire.’_
